intro: Cyrtandra brighamii, commonly known as Brigham's piper, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and streamside areas. It has heart-shaped leaves and produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
